methods.javadoc:
Do not use this constructor directly.  Instead, use the factory method:
 {@link #createOptionComponent(EditorState)}
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Do not use this constructor directly.  Instead, use the factory method:
 #createOptionComponent(EditorState)

methods.name: createOptionComponent
methods.comment: A factory method to create new OptionComponents.

params.name: state
params.comment: The state that will be used to create the correct OptionComponent

methods.javadoc:
Creates and sets a preferred alignment based upon the given list of option components.
@param components the list of options components from which to determine the alignment.
methods.name: alignLabels
methods.comment: Creates and sets a preferred alignment based upon the given list of option components.

params.name: components
params.comment: the list of options components from which to determine the alignment.

methods.name: setAlignmentPreferredSize
methods.comment:
Sets the alignment dimension on this component.  This is used internally to align
 components.

methods.javadoc:
Gets this components alignment dimension.
@return the alignment dimension.
methods.name: getPreferredAlignmentSize
